elements.text: PART ONE
THEME
1: EXT./INT. ALENDRA (BRIDGE
Page 2
(SPACE. EMPTY. A SPACESHIP, THE ALENDRA, BURSTS INTO HEARING.
HI-TECH EQUIPMENT. READ-OUTS CHATTER. MUTED
ACTIVITY )
And we’re out of the warpstream.
Adjust speed for normal space.
(OPERATING CONTROLS) Captain.
Regulate systems and lower protective beacon. Is it transmitting?
Operating trace.
(RIGA PRESSES BUTTONS. TENSE SILENCE. FILLS THE ROOM)
Excellent. There we are.
Locking onto signal now. (PRESSES BUT
Thank you, Pilot.
Might be on automatic.
Optimism costs nothing, Commander.
signal is locked in.
Set a course for planet-fall as near of transmission.
shields. Scan for their
as possible
to the
source
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 3
Setting course. (BUTTONS PRESSED) Estimated arrival... thirty- four minutes.
Commander. Have Prince Kylo and Ambassador Tuvold meet me in the ops room in five minutes. Inform the troops of our ETA and order them to prepare for engagement.
Ma’am.
Empire be praised.
Empire be praised.
A DOOR SLIDES OPEN, CORWYN EXITS
Pilot Riga. Set engines to full oar.
Ma’am.
Let’s see how this goes.
RIGA HITS SOME BUTTONS. THE SHIP ENGINES BURN
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 4
2: INT. ALENDRA (LAB
(SCIENTIFIC EQUIPMENT. COMPUTERS BEEPING, TAKING READOUTS. MONITORS. A FERAL CREATURE, AN IGRIS, GROWLS AND PACES IN A
BEHIND AN ELECTRICAL FORCEWALL)
There, there. Calm down. Would you like some food?
ROARS, LUNGES
A HISS OF ENERGY. IT’S PUSHED BACK
No, no, careful. Only hurt yourself when you do that, remember? Keep away from the forcewall.
WHIMPERS
There we are. Good boy. Good boy. Here you go.
(HE PRESSES SOME BUTTONS. FOOD IS VENTED INTO THE CELL. IT
FOR THE FOOD. A DOOR HISSES OPEN BEHIND KYLO. ALTUS
See. Just needed a little patience, didn’t you?
Prince Kylo?
(JUMPS) I didn’t do anything!
(SIGHS) Again? Must we do this again? I’ve told you before, your highness, the Igris isn’t a pet.
I know, but...
(ALTUS BRUSHES PAST KYLO AND STARTS TO MANIPULATE COMPUTER

It’s an eight foot tall bipedal killing machine. A sabre- toothed emissary of death. That’s why it’s caged. Those claws could rip your head off in a second, do you really think it’s wise to let it out and stroke its fur?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 5
I didn’t let him out.
(HIS COMPUTER BEEPS. READS) Life signs stable. Forcewall secure...
See, I’m not stupid!
Well, you’ve been trying very hard to give that impression.
(BEAT) He just seems in such pain...
He’s an experimental subject, a laboratory specimen, he’s supposed to be in pain. And it’s not a he, it’s an ‘it’.
‘It’ then. ‘It’ seems to be in pain.
(BEAT) Have you been keeping up your medication?
What? Oh. Yes. My medication. My beloved medication, yes, of course I have.
Really?
Yes! I’ve no choice.
Good. (COMPUTER BEEPS. READING) Aggression levels increasing... well, that’s only to be expected, I suppose.
He’s not as bad as you think, you know. The Igris.
Isn’t it.
I think I’m getting through to him, you see. I think he’s... learning. He comes when I call. When I enter the room. Like he knows me.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 6
It knows you bring food.
Sometimes... it’s like I can hear him. Hear his... mind...
(TO HIMSELF) And download... (PRESSES BUTTONS, THE COMPUTER WHIRRS) Sorry, what was that?
Oh, nothing. Nothing. Thinking aloud. He wants to be left alone, you know. Just wants to be left alone.
Really. Then perhaps you should concede to his desires. (THE
BEEPS) There we are, done. (A SMALL DEVICE POPS OUT. HE POCKETS IT. HE STARTS TO MOVE FOR THE DOOR)
What are you doing?
I’ve downloaded the research. Captain Shira wants it as soon as possible.
She — (BEAT) We’re nearly there?
You can hear we’re out of the warpstream.
I thought the ship sounded different.
Then it seems a logical inference.
THE DOOR SLIDES OPEN. CORWYN ENTERS
Prince Kylo! I was told you might be in the lab. We came out of warpstream a few minutes ago. Captain Shira wants you to meet her in the operations room for a briefing.
Is there any word from Aliona?
(BEAT) No. Nothing concrete. There’s a signal, but no reason to assume it was operated manually.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 7
(BEAT) She’s alive.
We don’t know that for certain...
I know what I know. She’s alive. She must be. I can’t have come all this way for nothing. Empire be praised! She’s alive!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 8
3: INT. ALENDRA (ANNEXE
THE TARDIS MATERIALISES. AFTER A MOMENT THE DOORS OPEN
(CALLING OUT FROM INSIDE) Nyssa, Tegan! It’s me, I’m —
HE STEPS OUT AND STOP HIMSELF. QUIETER NOW. WALKS AROUND

Ah. Right. Unless it’s had quite a radical design overhaul I’m fairly certain this isn’t a Youth Hostel. Probably not even Amsterdam. Some kind of spaceship? (JUMPS UP AND DOWN, TESTING GRAVITY) Certainly artificial gravity. Let’s see what’s through [here, shall we —]
(HE OPERATES A DOOR. BEHIND, TEN SOLDIERS CASUALLY TALKING
THEMSELVES AND PREPPING WEAPONRY: )
Warpstream jump makes me sick. —
Oh, man! Broken bowstring. —
And she said, you’re a little short for a Sorsha trooper. —
THEY ALL GO SUDDENLY SILENT
Ah.
Who in Empire’s -?
Soldiers, yes, of course, what else was it going to be? I imagine this doesn’t look too good.
Draw bows!
LASER LONGBOWS ARE DRAWN
Laser longbows, well at least you’re original.
Stay where you are!
Funnily enough I wasn’t planning on moving.
Hands in the air.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 9
I’m way ahead of you.
You’re under arrest.
Am I? Oh, what a surprise. Honestly, what was that, thirty seconds? Well, at least I’ve got it over with.
You’re coming to the bridge.
But of course I am, I’d expect nothing less.
This way!
Yes, yes, alright, I’m walking, I’m walking, I know the drill..
THEY MARCH OFF
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 10
4: INT. ALENDRA (OPERATIONS ROOM
QUIETER THAN THE BRIDGE. A DOOR HISSES OPEN. KYLO ENTERS
Captain.
You’re late.
I know, I... sorry. Sorry, Ambassador.
That’s quite alright, your highness.
Well let’s not waste any more time.
Can I get a glass of water?
(BEAT. UNIMPRESSED) Yes. That’s the food dispenser.
(KYLO GOES TO A FOOD MACHINE UNDER, PRESSES SOME BUTTONS AND IS
SOME WATER IN A GLASS. SHIRA PRESSES SOME BUTTONS IN THE FOREGROUND. A HOLOGRAPHIC DISPLAY BUZZES INTO LIFE)
There we are, gentlemen. Sharnax. Our destination.
Right. Uninspiring, isn’t it?

You'd never think such a nondescript planetoid would cause so much trouble. Still. It’s the little stuff you overlook that gets you in the end. Now we’re close we’ve been able to establish a firmer location trace. The beacon signal’s transmitting from this spot here. Quite a lot of the planet’s marshland, but that bit’s firm enough. Should be able to drop a lander pretty close.
If it’s firm ground there’s less chance of survivors, surely.
Depends whether they had time to launch a life raft. We won’t know for sure until we check. (SHE PRESSES SOME BUTTONS, THE
FADES) The good news is this means we can send all the troops. They’re prepping their bows. I’m leading the landing party.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 11
You are?
Corwyn’s perfectly capable of command if anything goes wrong.
When do we leave?
We?
I’m coming with you.
BEAT. SHIRA LAUGHS
No, your highness. No, you’re not.
But... I’ve got to go. This is my betrothed - .
Yes. And if we rescue her I’m sure she’d like a husband to come back to.
I’m the heir to the Royal House of Sorsha. Your ruling family. I order you to take me with you.

You don’t have jurisdiction on my ship, your highness. It’s my command, a military command. I order you. Keeping you informed’s a courtesy, not an obligation. I was letting you know the state of play, it wasn’t an invitation.
Lead from the front, you said —
You’re staying here. I’m sorry.
A COMMUNICATOR BEEPS. SHIRA ANSWERS
Shira.
(OVER COMMUNICATOR) Captain, this is Riga. We’ve a report from one of the troopers. He’s found a stowaway.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 12
What? Where?
(DISTORT) Armoury three annexe. He’s in the brig.
(BEAT) Thank you Pilot, Shira out.
SHE SWITCHES OFF THE COMMUNICATOR
A stowaway?
A seemingly suicidal one, this is hardly a pleasure cruise. With me, Ambassador. This might have political ramifications.
Er... yes.
And me?
You’re staying here.
(BEAT. SUDDEN INTENSITY) Why does everyone treat me as if I’m made out of glass?
I’m sorry, your highness, but I’ve got to keep you safe. This man’s potentially dangerous, we can’t risk your life.
I don’t need to be coddled, I’m not a fool!
No one thinks you are. But your father’s lost two sons, I doubt he’d care to lose another. I’m sorry. Ambassador.
Captain.
SHIRA AND TUVOLD EXIT. WITH A CRY, KYLO KNOCKS ASIDE A CHAIR
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 13
Idiot woman. Telling me what to do. Who does she think she is?!
HIS WATER STARTS TO BUBBLE AND BOIL IN ITS GLASS
Just you wait, Shira Calanah. Just you - (SUDDEN PAIN) Ah!
HE DROPS THE GLASS. IT SHATTERS
The water — it.. it boiled, I... oh no. NO!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 14
5: INT. ALENDRA (BRIG
DOORS OPEN THE OTHER SIDE OF THE ROOM. SHIRA AND TUVOLD ENTER
So this is a sort of space-faring feudalistic society, is it?
Quiet.
Must be, what, thirty of you on board? Er, do you mind not pointing that arrow at my head, it’s awfully disconcerting...
That must be him.
Apparently so.
SHIRA’S GROUP WALK TOWARDS THE DOCTOR
Are all your weapons derived from bowstring armaments or do you have any more conventional projectile weaponry...?
I said quiet!
Well, you were the one that insisted on dragging me up here. If you didn’t want a conversation, why on Earth did you keep me around?
SHIRA’S GROUP HAVE REACHED HIM
Now look here — !
At ease, trooper.
(BEAT) Ma’am.
Oh, and just when we’d broken the ice too.
Is this the intruder?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 15
What tipped you off? You must be the Captain. Shira, wasn’t it? (SHAKES HER HAND) That’s what this gentleman here called you. I’m the Doctor. How do you do?
How do I do what?
Well... (BEAT) You know I’ve honestly no idea.
Tyron, isn’t it, Trooper?
Yes, ma’am.
Talk to me, Tyron.
He’s a spy, ma’am.
Oh not again. Why do they always go for ‘spy’?
We found him in the armoury three annexe.
Technically, I found you.
Whatever. We were getting ready and he was there. Spying. Must be Gadarel.
What?

Oh for goodness’ — Look, I am not working for anyone. I told you. I’m not a spy. I am never a spy. A spy would ask questions, find out troop numbers, make all manner of enquiries about the weapons you’ve got on board, etcetera, etcetera and I’m not doing myself any favours, am I?
No.
I’1l shut up now.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 16
Well, Ambassador?
He’s nothing to do with me, I’ve never seen him before in my life.
(DRILY) Because if he was a spy you’d admit it immediately.
Captain, why would we smuggle someone on board? I’m here. What could he learn undercover I couldn’t find out legitimately?
Relax, Tuvold. No, I don’t think he’s a spy.
At last, someone who listens.
I think he’s a saboteur.
Brilliant.
He was found near armoury three, Ambassador. That’s where we keep the flare charges. One of those could blast a hole half a mile long in the side of this ship, two’d take us out of the sky.
A bomb?
Not everyone from House Gadarel supports the peace initiative and the marriage, you must know that.
Not everyone from House Sorsha either.
I’m by no means ruling us out. There’s plenty on both sides who’d do anything to see this mission fail.
Including kill the heir to their own throne?
Lose the battle, win the war. Somebody brought Aliona’s ship down, remember.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 17
Er, if I might be permitted to make a suggestion?
(BEAT) Yes?

Look, I’m sure this is a fascinating discussion, but it is all rather academic. I’m not a spy or a saboteur, a Sorsha or Gadarel, whatever they are, I’m a traveller. A simple traveller, a wanderer in the stars. I arrived here by accident no more than ten minutes ago. This is honestly a misunderstanding.
A wanderer in the stars?
Yes.
Who happened to wander into the armoury of a military transport vessel? It’s a bit off the tourist track, you’ll forgive me if I find the concept hard to believe.
Well, it wasn’t deliberate, obviously. I have a transport capsule, it can be a trifle... wilful at times, you can’t always be sure where you’re going to end up. I was actually heading for Amsterdam.
Where?
Amsterdam, Holland, that’s not important right now, look, what say I take you down to, um.. the annexe, that’s what you called it, wasn’t it Tyron?
What?
The annexe, yes. Why don’t I take you down to the annexe, I can show you my travel capsule. It is all totally innocent, I promise you.
PAUSE
Very well.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 18
You’re not going?
Could be a trap, ma’am.
Well, of course it could be a trap, that’s the point. Want to see what your enemy’s planning, sometimes you’ve got to spring them. Alright, ‘Doctor’. I’m willing to take you at your word.
Good.
Tuvold, let Corwyn know what’s happening.
You don’t want me with you?
We're already dealing with one interplanetary incident, Ambassador, we could do without another. Tyron can keep him under guard.
Ma’am.
Oh, I’1l1 be no trouble.
You’d better not. Alright then, ‘wanderer’. Lead the way!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 19
6: INT. ALENDRA (CREW ROOM
(GENERAL MARINE CHAT IN THE BACKGROUND:
Right, come on everyone, we’ve got ten minutes, we need to be ready in ten minutes. —
How many arrowbolts we gonna need?
Watch it, don’t point that at me when it’s loaded. —
Get your ugly mug out of my face. —
(.. ETC. LOCKERS BEING OPENED AND CLOSED. PEOPLE DRESSING. BANDAK AND LUDAN ARE TALKING IN THE FOREGROUND. LUDAN PUTTING ON HER UNIFORM, BANDAK PLAYING WITH HIS BOW)
(ROOTING AROUND IN LOCKER) Where’s my belt...
Look at it. Beautiful. Don’t get craftsmanship like this any more. Double nocked. One pump and — (HE PUMPS HIW BOW) — there
you go. Two arrowbolts ready to fire.
Ah, here it is. (CLOSES LOCKER) Sometimes it’s like you’re married to that bow.
Would be if they’d let me. Ain’t met a woman better. Present company excepted.
(PUTTING ON BELT) Course.
You’re practically a man though, anyway.
Mate, we’re supposed to be getting ready, not drooling over the bows... Get your armour (on) — Ah, nuts, left me battery in the
bunk. How long we got?
Quarter of an hour?
Don’t drop without me. (SHE HEADS FOR THE DOOR)
‘Bout time she saw some action. Shame it ain’t gonna be Gadarel, but —
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 20
LUDAN OPENS THE DOOR. THE IGRIS STANDS BEHIND IT, GROWLING
No! (SCREAMS AS...)
ROARS
IT SLASHES LUDAN IN TWO
What in Empire’s — ? The Igris? How did — ?
(IT CHARGES INTO THE ROOM. STARTS CUTTING AND SLASHING AT ALL THE TROOPERS )
Draw strings!
(THE IGRIS IS SLASHING AND KILLING EVERYWHERE. BANDAK AND OTHER
DRAW THEIR BOWSTRINGS )
Fire! (HE DOES. A DOUBLE SHOT) And fire! (AGAIN)
IT CONTINUES TO SLASH AND KILL
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 21
7: INT. ALENDRA (CORRIDOR
SHIRA, TYRON AND THE DOCTOR WALKING
Tell me, Captain. This voyage of yours. It’s a rescue mission, isn’t it?
Quiet!
Let him speak. Doctor, for someone who claims they’re not a spy, you’re certainly paying attention.
Well, I do like to keep my ears open.
You really don’t know?
I really don’t.
(BEAT) Call me insane, but I’m almost beginning to believe you.
I have that effect on most people. You said something about a downed ship. Aliona’s?
Yes. Princess Aliona. Her wedding galley.
Her — Of course. The peace initiative and the marriage. With Houses Sorsha and Gadarel as the happy couple.
She’s marrying Prince Kylo of the Sorsha. If you really only did arrive in this sector ten minutes ago, you pick things up remarkably quickly.
What can I say, it’s a gift. You’re trying to unite two feuding families.
That’s right.
Royal Families, no less. A battle for the crown?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 22
(BEAT) You are good aren’t you.
Oh, one doesn’t like to boast.
The Gadarel and the Sorsha have been at war since the mad Emperor was deposed decades ago. The heads of both houses claim dominion over the Drashani empire.
But of course they do, the Drashani empire. So that’s where we are.
You know it?
Only by reputation.
What’s its reputation?
A galaxy-spanning civilisation to rival Earth’s. The glory of Rome set among the stars. You know, I’ve never been here before, how fascinating.
Rome?
(AS THEY MOVE, WE BEGIN TO HEAR THE BATTLE IN THE CREW ROOM
AHEAD)
So to create a peace, marriage is brokered between the houses.
Valdarn Gadarel was gaining the upper hand but he was killed in battle a few months back. His daughter’s sole heir and she’s got a far less warlike temperament. And far less design for power.
Two families ruling as one. Well, it’s worked before, it’s a classic gambit.
(DISTRACTED) Can you hear that?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 23
But it’s all threatened when one of the affianced parties is lost, so to speak, at sea. Yes, I can quite see why you’d be in a hurry to get her back...
A COMMUNICATOR BEEPS
What now?
(SHE OPENS A CHANNEL. NOISE OF THE SLAUGHTER AND BOWFIGHT UP
FILTERS THROUGH)
(OVER COMMUNICATOR) Captain! Captain Shira, this is Trooper Bandak, this is an emergency, the Igris is out, I repeat, the Igris is — Aagh!
HE’S KILLED, THE COMMUNICATION CUTS OUT
Bandak? Come in! Bandak?
What was that?
It came from the crew room! COME ON!
THEY RUN OFF AS A GROUP
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 24
8: INT. ALENDRA (CORRIDOR OUTSIDE CREW ROOM
(THE SOUNDS OF WHOLESALE SLAUGHTER INSIDE THE CREW ROOM. SCREAMS. ARROWS. ETC)
Oh, no.
ROARS, TURNING TO THE DOOR
It’s spotted us! Tyron, open fire, keep it back.
IT ADVANCES
Ma’am!
(HE LAUNCHES OFF ARROW AFTER ARROW WITH HIS AUTOMATIC LONGBOW.
HITTING CONTROLS )
Come on, come on, locking code.
THE DOOR HISSES SHUT. TYRON STOPS FIRING
Right, get back, retreat, that won’t last long...
(A HEAVY THUD FROM THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR. SHIRA, TYRON AND THE DOCTOR RETREAT )
But... but there were people in there!
They’re dead. Let’s not join them. Come on! (SHE OPERATES COMMUNICATOR)
It’ll be through any second.
I know. (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Corwyn? Corwyn, come in, Corwyn.
(OVER COMMUNICATOR) Ma’am?
The Igris is out.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 25
(DISTORT) The Igris? How?
Does it matter how? It’s out.
(THE DOOR AT THE OTHER END OF THE CORRIDOR IS SMASHED APART. THE IGRIS STEPS THROUGH GROWLING)
Captain!
Open fire!
What is that thing?
TYRON FIRES WHILST RETREATING
I ain’t stopping it!
Just need to keep it back. Corwyn! Send squads two and three to corridor C12.
(DISTORT) What about squad one, they’re closer?
Yes, but they’re dead, Corwyn, they’re all dead! All remaining troops to corridor C12. (TO TYRON) Get behind the door, trooper.
THE IGRIS IS CLOSING. SHIRA HITS THE DOOR CONTROL. IT SHUTS
Is this one going to hold any better?
A CRUNCH FROM THE OTHER SIDE. THEY RETREAT RUNNING AGAIN
Take a wild guess. (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Get Altus, Corwyn. I want his research. I want to know how to stop that thing!
(DISTORT) Ma’am.
And hurry, there’s only so many bulkheads between us and the flight deck!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 26
What is that, Captain, an ‘Igris’?
Yes.
What’s an Igris?
An unstoppable killing machine.
I see. And how it did one get on board?
How d’you think? We brought it.
What?
It’s a research tool. We’ve been trying to find a way of stopping them.
Well, that experiment’s going to be a rather more practical proposition now, then isn’t it?
THE IGRIS BREAKS THROUGH THE DOOR AGAIN
Open fire!
TYRON LETS OFF MORE ARROWS. TWENTY TROOPERS RUN UP BEHIND
Reinforcements Ma’am.
Great. Open fire!
(THE REINFORCEMENTS SHOOT AUTOMATIC LASERBOWS AT THE IGRIS. IT
CLOSING, ROARING)
It’s closing.
Maintain barrage! Keep it back as long as we can! Tyron. Take this man to the Bridge and stay with him.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 27
What?
But I can help!
You don’t know what we’re up against, Doctor, always assuming you didn’t let it out in the first place... Tyron, give me your bow —
It’s my job, Captain. Fall back.
That’s an order, Trooper, follow it!
BEAT) Ma’am. Here you are. (HANDS OVER THE BOW.TO THE DOCTOR
You. This way.
Right behind you.
THE DOCTOR AND TYRON RUN OFF. SHIRA STARTS FIRING
Keep firing!
SOME TROOPERS AT THE FRONT ARE CUT DOWN, SCREAMING
Alright, fall back! Fall back!
THEY RETREAT, LOOSING ARROWS ALL THE TIME
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 28
9: INT. ALENDRA (BRIDGE
COMPUTER READOUTS RUNNING
Life signs seventeen. Sixteen. (SPORADICALLY IN B/G:) [Fifteen. Fourteen. Thirteen. Twelve. Eleven. ]
This is appalling.
Oh, like you’re not enjoying it, Gadarel.
I beg your pardon?
Enough, Pilot! Job in hand!
It’s killing the lot of them!
You think I haven’t noticed? How long til we hit atmosphere?
(CHECKS A READING) Five minutes...
They’re dying!
We’1ll be dead too if we can’t figure out how to stop that thing. Altus, talk to me.
There’s nothing that works on the move, Commander, it’s unstoppable.
Don’t tell me that!
What do you want me to say?
They’re being slaughtered!
This is an atrocity, we have to do something!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 29
We're trying to! (OPERATING A COMMUNICATOR) Captain this is Corwyn, there’s a negative from Altus, I repeat, a negative, I
(TYRON AND THE DOCTOR ENTER, CORWYN SWITCHES OFF THE COMMUNICATOR)
Commander.
Who’s — ?
I’m the Doctor.
The stowaway!
Lost traveller, there’s a difference.
You did this!
We don’t have time to discuss it! Open a communication channel
to Captain Shira!
But —
Do it!
(CORWYN PRESSES BUTTONS. THE SOUND OF THE FIGHTING FILLS THE BRIDGE)
Captain? Captain Shira, are you there?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 30
10: INT. ALENDRA (CORRIDOR
THE IGRIS ATTACKING AND KILLING. ARROWS BEING LOOSED
Doctor? What are you [doing on comms-? ]
(OVER COMMUNICATOR) Seriously, now is not the time for
questions.
(CALLING OUT) Close the next bulkhead!
A TROOPER TAPS IN A CODE. THE DOOR CLOSES
Fall back.
THEY RUN AS THE DOOR IS ATTACKED
(INTO COMMUNICATOR) Alright, what, I can’t retreat forever.
(DISTORT) You said you brought that thing on board.
What of it?
(DISTORT) Well, you must have had it caged otherwise it’d have run free ages ago.
Of course we did.
(DISTORT) Then what was it caged with?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 31
11: INT. ALENDRA (BRIDGE
A forcewall. We had it behind a forcewall —
A force — Sorry, I don’t think we’ve been introduced, I’m the Doctor.
Kylo.
Oh, the Prince! Congratulations on the engagement. Hope the actual marriage goes more smoothly.
Three minutes to atmosphere.
This isn’t helping!
(DISTORT) Doctor!
Yes, of course, sorry, got a bit distracted, sorry. You can stop it with forcefields, is that right?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 32
12: INT. ALENDRA (CORRIDOR
THE IGRIS BURSTS THROUGH
Fire at will! (INTO COMMUNICATOR AS A VOLLEY EXPLODES ROUND HER, THEY FIRE AND RETREAT) Yes, but we can’t generate them in the corridors, we weren’t prepared for this!
(DISTORT) Where can you generate them? It’s following you, lure it there.
(BEAT) The Armouries! It’s a failsafe if the ship’s boarded.
(DISTORT) Can you get to one quickly?
Yes, armoury three, where we were heading.
(DISTORT) Then I suggest you get a move on.
Point taken. Out. (SHE CUTS OFF THE COMMUNICATOR) You heard the
man, armoury three! Come on!
THEY RUN, FIRING ARROWS, THE IGRIS PURSUING, KILLING

DOCTOR: What can I say, it’s a gift. You’re trying to unite two feuding families.
SHIRA: That’s right.
DOCTOR: Royal Families, no less. A battle for the crown?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 22
SHIRA: (BEAT) You are good aren’t you.
DOCTOR: Oh, one doesn’t like to boast.
SHIRA: The Gadarel and the Sorsha have been at war since the mad Emperor was deposed decades ago. The heads of both houses claim dominion over the Drashani empire.
DOCTOR: But of course they do, the Drashani empire. So that’s where we are.
SHIRA: You know it?
DOCTOR: Only by reputation.
SHIRA: What’s its reputation?
DOCTOR: A galaxy-spanning civilisation to rival Earth’s. The glory of Rome set among the stars. You know, I’ve never been here before, how fascinating.
SHIRA: Rome?
SHIRA: (AS THEY MOVE, WE BEGIN TO HEAR THE BATTLE IN THE CREW ROOM
DISTANTLY: AHEAD)
DOCTOR: So to create a peace, marriage is brokered between the houses.
SHIRA: Valdarn Gadarel was gaining the upper hand but he was killed in battle a few months back. His daughter’s sole heir and she’s got a far less warlike temperament. And far less design for power.
DOCTOR: Two families ruling as one. Well, it’s worked before, it’s a classic gambit.
SHIRA: (DISTRACTED) Can you hear that?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 23
DOCTOR: But it’s all threatened when one of the affianced parties is lost, so to speak, at sea. Yes, I can quite see why you’d be in a hurry to get her back...
SHIRA: What now?
SHIRA: (SHE OPENS A CHANNEL. NOISE OF THE SLAUGHTER AND BOWFIGHT UP
AHEAD: FILTERS THROUGH)
BANDAK: (OVER COMMUNICATOR) Captain! Captain Shira, this is Trooper Bandak, this is an emergency, the Igris is out, I repeat, the Igris is — Aagh!
SHIRA: Bandak? Come in! Bandak?
DOCTOR: What was that?
SHIRA: It came from the crew room! COME ON!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 24
DOCTOR WHO: (THE SOUNDS OF WHOLESALE SLAUGHTER INSIDE THE CREW ROOM. SCREAMS. ARROWS. ETC)
DOCTOR: Oh, no.
SHIRA: It’s spotted us! Tyron, open fire, keep it back.
TYRON: Ma’am!
TYRON: (HE LAUNCHES OFF ARROW AFTER ARROW WITH HIS AUTOMATIC LONGBOW.
SHIRA: HITTING CONTROLS )
SHIRA: Come on, come on, locking code.
SHIRA: Right, get back, retreat, that won’t last long...
SHIRA: (A HEAVY THUD FROM THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR. SHIRA, TYRON AND THE DOCTOR RETREAT )
DOCTOR: But... but there were people in there!
SHIRA: They’re dead. Let’s not join them. Come on! (SHE OPERATES COMMUNICATOR)
TYRON: It’ll be through any second.
SHIRA: I know. (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Corwyn? Corwyn, come in, Corwyn.
CORWYN: (OVER COMMUNICATOR) Ma’am?
SHIRA: The Igris is out.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 25
CORWYN: (DISTORT) The Igris? How?
SHIRA: Does it matter how? It’s out.
SHIRA: (THE DOOR AT THE OTHER END OF THE CORRIDOR IS SMASHED APART. THE IGRIS STEPS THROUGH GROWLING)
TYRON: Captain!
SHIRA: Open fire!
DOCTOR: What is that thing?
TYRON: I ain’t stopping it!
SHIRA: Just need to keep it back. Corwyn! Send squads two and three to corridor C12.
CORWYN: (DISTORT) What about squad one, they’re closer?
SHIRA: Yes, but they’re dead, Corwyn, they’re all dead! All remaining troops to corridor C12. (TO TYRON) Get behind the door, trooper.
DOCTOR: Is this one going to hold any better?
SHIRA: Take a wild guess. (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Get Altus, Corwyn. I want his research. I want to know how to stop that thing!
CORWYN: (DISTORT) Ma’am.
SHIRA: And hurry, there’s only so many bulkheads between us and the flight deck!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 26
DOCTOR: What is that, Captain, an ‘Igris’?
SHIRA: Yes.
DOCTOR: What’s an Igris?
SHIRA: An unstoppable killing machine.
DOCTOR: I see. And how it did one get on board?
SHIRA: How d’you think? We brought it.
DOCTOR: What?
SHIRA: It’s a research tool. We’ve been trying to find a way of stopping them.
DOCTOR: Well, that experiment’s going to be a rather more practical proposition now, then isn’t it?
SHIRA: Open fire!
TROOPER: Reinforcements Ma’am.
SHIRA: Great. Open fire!
SHIRA: (THE REINFORCEMENTS SHOOT AUTOMATIC LASERBOWS AT THE IGRIS. IT
KEEPS: CLOSING, ROARING)
TYRON: It’s closing.
SHIRA: Maintain barrage! Keep it back as long as we can! Tyron. Take this man to the Bridge and stay with him.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 27
TYRON: What?
DOCTOR: But I can help!
SHIRA: You don’t know what we’re up against, Doctor, always assuming you didn’t let it out in the first place... Tyron, give me your bow —
TYRON: It’s my job, Captain. Fall back.
SHIRA: That’s an order, Trooper, follow it!
TYRON: You. This way.
DOCTOR: Right behind you.
SHIRA: Keep firing!
SHIRA: Alright, fall back! Fall back!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 28
RIGA: Life signs seventeen. Sixteen. (SPORADICALLY IN B/G:) [Fifteen. Fourteen. Thirteen. Twelve. Eleven. ]
TUVOLD: This is appalling.
RIGA: Oh, like you’re not enjoying it, Gadarel.
TUVOLD: I beg your pardon?
CORWYN: Enough, Pilot! Job in hand!
KYLO: It’s killing the lot of them!
CORWYN: You think I haven’t noticed? How long til we hit atmosphere?
RIGA: (CHECKS A READING) Five minutes...
KYLO: They’re dying!
CORWYN: We’1ll be dead too if we can’t figure out how to stop that thing. Altus, talk to me.
ALTUS: There’s nothing that works on the move, Commander, it’s unstoppable.
CORWYN: Don’t tell me that!
ALTUS: What do you want me to say?
KYLO: They’re being slaughtered!
TUVOLD: This is an atrocity, we have to do something!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 29
CORWYN: We're trying to! (OPERATING A COMMUNICATOR) Captain this is Corwyn, there’s a negative from Altus, I repeat, a negative, I
CORWYN: (TYRON AND THE DOCTOR ENTER, CORWYN SWITCHES OFF THE COMMUNICATOR)
TYRON: Commander.
CORWYN: Who’s — ?
DOCTOR: I’m the Doctor.
TYRON: The stowaway!
DOCTOR: Lost traveller, there’s a difference.
CORWYN: You did this!
DOCTOR: We don’t have time to discuss it! Open a communication channel
DOCTOR: to Captain Shira!
CORWYN: But —
DOCTOR: Do it!
DOCTOR: (CORWYN PRESSES BUTTONS. THE SOUND OF THE FIGHTING FILLS THE BRIDGE)
DOCTOR: Captain? Captain Shira, are you there?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 30
SHIRA: Doctor? What are you [doing on comms-? ]
DOCTOR: (OVER COMMUNICATOR) Seriously, now is not the time for
DOCTOR: questions.
SHIRA: (CALLING OUT) Close the next bulkhead!
SHIRA: Fall back.
SHIRA: (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Alright, what, I can’t retreat forever.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) You said you brought that thing on board.
SHIRA: What of it?
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Well, you must have had it caged otherwise it’d have run free ages ago.
SHIRA: Of course we did.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Then what was it caged with?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 31
KYLO: A forcewall. We had it behind a forcewall —
DOCTOR: A force — Sorry, I don’t think we’ve been introduced, I’m the Doctor.
KYLO: Kylo.
DOCTOR: Oh, the Prince! Congratulations on the engagement. Hope the actual marriage goes more smoothly.
RIGA: Three minutes to atmosphere.
CORWYN: This isn’t helping!
SHIRA: (DISTORT) Doctor!
DOCTOR: Yes, of course, sorry, got a bit distracted, sorry. You can stop it with forcefields, is that right?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 32
SHIRA: Fire at will! (INTO COMMUNICATOR AS A VOLLEY EXPLODES ROUND HER, THEY FIRE AND RETREAT) Yes, but we can’t generate them in the corridors, we weren’t prepared for this!
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Where can you generate them? It’s following you, lure it there.
SHIRA: (BEAT) The Armouries! It’s a failsafe if the ship’s boarded.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Can you get to one quickly?
SHIRA: Yes, armoury three, where we were heading.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Then I suggest you get a move on.
SHIRA: Point taken. Out. (SHE CUTS OFF THE COMMUNICATOR) You heard the
SHIRA: man, armoury three! Come on!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 33
RIGA: Life signs ten.
TUVOLD: No...
KYLO: We’re going to lose them all, aren’t we? We’re going to die!
DOCTOR: We are not going to die! You, are you the Science officer?
ALTUS: Strictly speaking the medical officer, but I cover basic sciences, yes...
DOCTOR: Thought so, you had the look. Can you generate the armoury forcewall remotely from up here?
ALTUS: I — I don’t know if I should be taking orders from a —
CORWYN: Do it, Altus! If it’s possible, do it!
ALTUS: Er, then yes. Yes I can.
DOCTOR: Excellent. So if you would.
CORWYN: Doctor, what are you planning?
DOCTOR: Explanations can wait, we don’t have the time. You. Tuvold, wasn’t it?
TUVOLD: Yes.
DOCTOR: Give him any help he needs.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 34
TUVOLD: Very well.
RIGA: Life signs five. Two minutes to atmosphere.
KYLO: We’ve got to stop this, we can’t die, we have to save her!
CORWYN: We don’t even know if she’s alive, we're the priorities at the moment, remember that!
DOCTOR: (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Captain, are you nearly there? You’re running out of men.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 35
DOCTOR WHO: (CHARGING THROUGH CORRIDORS. EIGHT TROOPERS FIRING. IGRIS CHASING)
SHIRA: I'd spotted that, thanks! Get that bulkhead down!
SHIRA: We're there. Trooper, operate priority override, one-one-five- nine.
TROOPER: Ma’am.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) We can operate the forcewall from the bridge, you just need to lure it in and get out.
SHIRA: Get inside, get to the back wall, we need it as far in as
SHIRA: possible then we split and try to get round on the outside.
TROOPER: Will that work?
SHIRA: I really hope so.
SHIRA: Right, in!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 36
RIGA: Life signs four. One minute to atmosphere.
DOCTOR: Are there any more troopers?
CORWYN: Only Tyron. The rest are down there or dead.
TYRON: I could head back.
DOCTOR: You'd just be another corpse, Tyron, you’re more use to us here.
KYLO: Please. For Aliona’s sake. We have to survive this!
DOCTOR: That is the plan.
SHIRA: (OVER COMMUNICATOR) I’m in, are you ready?
DOCTOR: Altus, Tuvold?
ALTUS: Give me the word.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 37
TUVOLD: (DISTORT, DISTANT) Whenever you want.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Everyone’s ready here.
SHIRA: (QUIETLY) Come on. Come on.
SHIRA: Alright, now!
SHIRA: (THE REMAINING FOUR MAKE A MOVE. WITH A GROWL, THE IGRIS SLASHES AND TAKES DOWN TWO. SHIRA AND TROOPER GET OUT)
SHIRA: We’re out, hit it!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 38
RIGA: Life signs two.
DOCTOR: Altus, now!
DOCTOR: (ALTUS HITS THE BUTTON. SOMETHING ENORMOUS AND ENEGETIC POWERS UP — THEN DROPS OUT TO NOTHING ALMOST INSTANTLY )
DOCTOR: What on — ?
CORWYN: Nothing’s happening!
TUVOLD: It should have worked!
KYLO: No!
ALTUS: It’s been sabotaged!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 39
SHIRA: Doctor, it’s heading back out! It’s leaving the armoury, if you’re going to do something, do it now!
ALTUS: (DISTORT) The entire system’s down, that must be how it got free in the first place...
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Sorry, Captain, we’ve hit a little snag — someone’s destroyed the forcewalls...
SHIRA: What? Then we’re dead. (PAUSE) Trooper, can you get to a flare charge?
TROOPER: Captain, no, you can’t — !
TROOPER: Aargh!
SHIRA: All right, I’ll get it myself.
CORWYN: (DISTORT) Captain, what are you doing?
SHIRA: It’s out of the armoury. It’s just me now. The plan’s failed!
SHIRA: Oh no, you don’t!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL)
CORWYN: (INTO COMMS) Captain-? Answer me!
TYRON: She’s heading into the armoury.
DOCTOR: I’ve an awful feeling —
RIGA: We've hit atmosphere.
RIGA: Page 40
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 41
DOCTOR WHO: (SHIRA SCRAMBLES IN, FIRING ARROWS AS THE IGRIS FOLLOWS. GRABS
WHAT: SHE’S AFTER)
SHIRA: There we are, one flare charge. (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Riga, you’re the best pilot in the fleet, if anyone can do this, it’s you.
RIGA: (DISTORT, DISTANT) Captain — ?
SHIRA: (SHE FLICKS A SWITCH ON THE CHARGE. IT BUZZES) And primed. Commander Corwyn, you are now in charge. Everyone is to take their orders from Commander Corwyn.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Captain. Shira! You don’t have to do this, there’s another way, there’s got to be.
TYRON: (DISTORT) No.
TUVOLD: (DISTORT) Captain?
KYLO: (DISTORT) I don’t understand.
SHIRA: Sorry, Doctor. This thing escapes, we’re all dead, the mission’s too important for that.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Shira! Shira, no!
SHIRA: Nice knowing you. (SHE FLICKS A SWITCH ON THE CHARGE) Empire be — [praised]
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 42
DOCTOR WHO: (THE ENTIRE SHIP SHAKES. ALARMS BLARE. IT JUDDERS AND ROCKS. EVERYONE’S THROWN ABOUT. IT PLUMMETS, OUT OF CONTROL)
DOCTOR: Shira! Shira!
TUVOLD: She’s dead, Doctor! Blown a hole in the side of the ship, like she said!
RIGA: We’re going down!
KYLO: Why would she do that? We’re all going to die!
CORWYN: Can you stabilise our descent, pilot?
RIGA: tm trying!
ALTUS: At least she’s got rid of that creature, everything in armoury three’s just vented into the air!
DOCTOR: (BEAT) But my TARDIS was in there!
RIGA: Don’t know if I can get control back, Commander, number two engine’s blown, we’re nearing terminal velocity!
KYLO: Commander?
CORWYN: Can you get us down safe?
RIGA: This ship isn’t designed for landing!
CORWYN: Then do what you can!
RIGA: Sure? Crashing might be a mercy!
DOCTOR: What?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 43
RIGA: (LAUGHS BITTERLY) He has no idea what we’re up against, does he?
DOCTOR: I don’t so would someone please enlighten me?
CORWYN: Why’d you think we had one of those things on board?
DOCTOR: Research, wasn’t it? Shira said.
CORWYN: On a rescue mission?
DOCTOR: Well... it’s a trifle unusual, I’11 admit...
ALTUS: We had one on board because we needed to find out if it had any weaknesses!
DOCTOR: I.. I don’t understand.
CORWYN: The planet we were heading for, Doctor, the one we’re about to smash into? It’s an Igris world.
DOCTOR: What?
CORWYN: They took it over a decade ago. Killed everyone.
DOCTOR: But... but one of those things just wiped out your entire crew!
CORWYN: I know. And if we even survive the crash... there’s twenty thousand of them down there!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 44

THEME
22: INT. ALENDRA (BRIDGE) (CONTINUED
The planet we were heading for, Doctor, the one we’re about to smash into? It’s an Igris world.
What?
They took it over a decade ago. Killed everyone.
But... but one of those things just took out your entire crew!
I know. And if we even survive the crash... there’s twenty thousand of them down there!
Right. (BEAT) Well, let’s worry about them later, we’ve more important priorities. Riga. How long to impact?
Four minutes.
Is there no way of controlling our descent?
Not that I can see!
I did not sign on for this!
We’re going to die! We won’t save her, we’re all going to die!
A COMPUTER BANK EXPLODES
Keep back. The ship’s breaking down!
We can’t reverse the artificial gravity, loop it out, use it as a cushion of sorts?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 45
We’ve picked up too much speed, without downward thrust the impact’d still be enough to kill us!
Probably not a good idea then...
I've lost her forever!
It’s not her you should be worrying about. (BEAT) Not designed for landing, you said. This ship’s an orbiter!
Yes, what about it?
Well, you were planning on getting to the surface. You must have some sort of dropship. We can use that!
A drop — ?
The lander, sir!
Yes!
It’s travelling with the same momentum, it’1l still crash.
Maybe not. I presume its engines are intact. Use them for downward thrust, we might just lessen the impact.
PAUSE
Pilot?
Worth a shot. Keep in the air long enough, when this ship hits, we might even be able to ride the impact wave!
But it’s not designed for stellar travel, once we’re down we won’t be able to get offworld!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 46
Oh, you’re a beacon of positivity, aren’t you? Trust me, my
was sucked out into this planet’s upper atmosphere. It’s falling to the surface too but it’s rather more resilient than this ship. We can use it to get away.
TARDIS?
Falling?
There really isn’t time!
We can save her?
If I’m right, we can save everyone.
Pilot, can you lock the navigation systems?
(PRESSING BUTTONS) Already doing it, Commander. (BEAT) Done!
Everyone. I hereby give order to abandon ship! Got that? Abandon ship! Lift to the lower-hold. Now!
THEY SCRAMBLE FROM THE ROOM. ALARMS CONTINUE
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 47
23: INT. ALENDRA (LOWER-HOLD
(LIFT DOORS OPEN. ALARMS BLARING. SHIP SHAKING, UNDER MASSIVE STRAIN. THE GROUP RUN FROM THE LIFT)
Here we are. Riga, get on board. Initiate take-off procedure!
Sir!
SHE RUNS INTO THE LANDER
Tyron, get the bay doors open!
On it.
HE RUNS OFF, OPERATES CONTROLS
Everyone else, on board, now, strap yourselves in! Move, move,
move !
Well, seeing as you asked so nicely.
This is not what I signed on for...
Quickly! We can’t waste a second!
(THE OTHERS RUN ONTO THE SHIP. WHEN THEY’RE ON, WITH A
HISS, THE BAY DOORS BEGIN TO OPEN. WINDS BATTER THE
Bay doors open, sir.
Then follow me, we’re out of here!
THEY CHARGE ONTO THE LANDER
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 48
24: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
(ENGINES WHIRRING. THE SHIP SHAKING AS MUCH AS ITS PARENT. RIGA
BUTTONS, OPERATING CONTROLS. MACHINERY HUMMING INTO LIFE. THE DOCTOR RUNS UP)
Come on, come on...
Need a hand?
That lever there, pull it down half-way.
THE DOCTOR DOES
Retracting launch ramp... Stern-doors closing...
THE DOCTOR STRAPS HIMSELF IN BESIDE. CORWYN RUNS UP
Rear hatch closed and locked, we’re good to go!
Nearly there?
(SHE TWISTS A DIAL) There! Brace yourselves in the back!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 49
25: INT. LANDER (CREWROOM
TUVOLD, KYLO, ALTUS, TYRON STRAPPING THEMSELVES IN
How do you do these buckles?
Let me. (HELPS WITH THE BUCKLES)
Why are we wasting time? Why haven’t we launched?
It’s a complicated procedure, highness, give them time...
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 50
26: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
All codes inputted. Launch in three... two... one...
Here we go!
(THE LANDER DROPS OUT OF THE SHIP. MUCH BUFFETTING. IT’S HARD TO FLY, RIGA STRUGGLES WITH THE CONTROLS )
And we’re out! Get yourself strapped in, Commander!
CORWYN STRUGGLES TO SIT
I’m... trying...
Number two burner on?
When did you become co-pilot?
About thirty seconds ago, is that a problem?
(BEAT) No. Yes, number two burner, on!
THE DOCTOR OPERATES SWITCHES
Have we enough thrust?
Not sure.
CORWYN IS STRAPPED
I’m strapped in!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 51
27: INT. LANDER (CREWROOM
SHIP BUFFETTING OUTRAGEOUSLY
So glad I didn’t eat this morning... Is space-travel always like this?
Always. COME ON!
Don’t worry, it won’t last long.
Please let us survive this.. please let us survive this...
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 52
28: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
How long before the main ship hits?
The Alendra? Fifteen seconds!
The Alendra? Is that what it was called, I did wonder. Ride the impact wave when it hits, remember.
I’1ll do my best. (PAUSE) Five. Four. Three.
Alright everyone, hold on. Here we go!
Two. One.
29: EXT. SHARNAX (DRY LAND
(COMPARATIVELY QUIET, WITH THE SPACESHIP GLIDING THROUGH THE AIR. THEN IT HITS THE GROUND. ENORMOUS EXPLOSION)
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 53
30: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
(THE LANDER IS BUFFETTED EVEN MORE BY SHOCKWAVES. ALARMS BLARE.
WHINE INCREASINGLY. RIGA STRUGGLING WITH CONTROLS
Out of control! Going down!
What, we’re going to crash too?
Very possibly. This was a really well conceived plan.
Can you keep her in the air?
I’'1l see what I can do!
STEAM VENTS BEHIND
What the hell was that?
Power bank one’s gone!
Losing altitude!
Do something, Riga!
I’m trying!
Get back there, Doctor, see what’s going on!
On my way!
HE UNSTRAPS AND HEADS BACK
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 54
31: INT. LANDER (CREWROOM
STEAM VENTING
Can someone control that?!
I’m trying!
This is not good!
AN EXPLOSION TO THE REAR — CAUSED BY KYLO’S POWERS, IN FACT
What the —
What in Empire’s name was [that— ?]
(ARRIVING) Keep it calm, this is hard enough as it is.
The rear control bank... it just.. it just caught on fire...
It — ?
The systems must be under all manner of pressure. Bear with me. (CALLING BACK TO RIGA) Can you get her down safely?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 55
32: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
(CALLING BACK) I don’t think so. It’s a more controlled descent, yes, but it’1ll still be a fatal impact when we hit the ground!
(CALLING FROM BEHIND) Are the stern engines working?
(CALLING BACK) I’m giving it all we've got!
Come on, Riga!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 56
33: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
Marshland!
What?
This planet’s largely marshland, that’s what Shira said!
Marshland?
Surely that could cushion the landing?
It’s a possibility.
We could still survive?
THE DOCTOR RUNS BACK FOR THE CONTROL ROOM
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 57
34: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
THE DOCTOR RUNS IN
Is that right, Commander? This planet’s largely marshland? (BEAT) Well?
Er... yes, yes, I’m pretty certain I remember that from the briefing —
Riga, if we dive this ship into a marsh, can we survive the impact?
Ah...
Quickly!
. well, if it’s deep enough, there’s a chance. Beats solid ground, I suppose.
Excellent. Make a scan of the local area, find the deepest, marshiest marsh you can find, head for that.
Slight problem.
Yes?
This ship isn’t buoyant. It’s too heavy, it’1ll sink.
(BEAT) Ever get the feeling it’s not your day? Look, one thing at a time, Riga. Do the scan, if we survive the crash we can worry about drowning later.
Will do.
RIGA OPERATES MACHINERY
You think this’1l work?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page
By all means feel free to suggest an alternative.
A COMPUTER BEEPS
Got one! Grid factor five!
Full speed ahead!
(OPERATES CONTROLS) On my way!
Give it all the reverse thrust you can!
Coming in now!
(CALLING OUT) Everybody brace for impact!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 59
35: INT. LANDER (COCKPIT
Not again.
You'll be fine.
Ready?
No.
Here we go!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 60

CORWYN: I thought we’d agreed not to discuss that...
ALTUS: Riga. We were never sure about Riga. She was a risk.
CORWYN: She’s the finest pilot in the fleet.
ALTUS: And was a member of anti-Gadarel groups at the academy.
CORWYN: We all did things we weren’t proud of at the academy.
ALTUS: You saw how she reacted to the Doctor. And Tuvold.
CORWYN: Everyone’s a risk, Altus. You’re a risk. I’m a risk. My wife was caught in a Gadarel bombing raid, remember? Barely came out alive, did you forget that?
ALTUS: No, I —
CORWYN: I still want peace. I don’t want anyone else to suffer like her, like me. You can’t decide these things by numbers, Altus. Maybe Riga’s changed, changed her mind. People do that.
ALTUS: What if she hasn’t?
CORWYN: We’re not discussing this further. Prepare yourself. We’re nearly there. (OUT) Everyone. We reach the target in four minutes. Four minutes. Be ready. (TO ALTUS) Remember what I said, Altus.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 83
TUVOLD: You think you can get us off this planet?
DOCTOR: If I can find my ship I’m certain of it. Need to do a scan for temporal energies, there shouldn’t be any other sources down here...
KYLO: (MUTTERING TO HIMSELF) Medication. Always with the medication... (BUMPS INTO THE DOCTOR) Oops, sorry.
DOCTOR: No, no, that’s quite alright. Kylo, isn’t it? Didn’t really speak properly back on the ship. I’m the Doctor.
KYLO: Oh, yes, you said. Hello.
DOCTOR: Is something the matter?
KYLO: What? Oh, no. No, I’m just... distracted. It’s difficult to concentrate. You know, while Aliona’s out there. Lost.
DOCTOR: I see.
KYLO: Until I have her safe... I can’t relax.
DOCTOR: (BEAT) You really are in love with her, aren’t you?
KYLO: Of course. D’you think I’d come all this way if I wasn’t?
DOCTOR: Oh, not at all, it’s just these things are usually a marriage of convenience, no genuine affection on either side.
KYLO: She’s wonderful. The most beautiful girl I’ve ever seen. Never met anyone like her in my life.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 84
TUVOLD: She is a wonder to behold.
KYLO: No idea what she sees in me. Runt of the litter. The fall-back heir.
DOCTOR: Maybe she looks beyond those things.
KYLO: You know... I’d forgotten... if it wasn’t for the crash... today would have been our wedding day. I’d have been holding her in my arms right now.
DOCTOR: I hope you get her back.
KYLO: I'd better.
RIGA: (CALLING OUT FROM THE FRONT) Coming up on it now!
RIGA: (THE SKIMMER SHUDDERS TO A HALT. IGRIS PACE AROUND THE
BACKGROUND: )
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 85
DOCTOR: That’s the Galley?
TUVOLD: Doesn’t look in the best shape, does it?
CORWYN: We can’t make any assumptions.
ALTUS: We can’t scan for lifeforms from outside. The Igris are in the way, they’1ll interfere with the reading.
RIGA: All life rafts still attached. No-one got out that way.
DOCTOR: There can’t be any survivors, surely?
KYLO: She’s alive in there. She has to be.
CORWYN: Everybody suit up, we’re going on board.
TUVOLD: What? Everyone?
CORWYN: Got a problem with that?
KYLO: No. No, I have to find her. I have to be there.
TUVOLD: We’re not all of us trained for military activity, Commander.
CORWYN: I don’t want to spend any more time on this benighted rock than I have to. We need to search that thing, thoroughly. The more of us go in, the quicker we get out. Got that? We’re all there.
DOCTOR: Does it have any intact airlocks?
RIGA: (CHECKS A READOUT) Just the one I can see.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 86
DOCTOR: Then it shouldn’t be a problem. We can get across without disturbing the Igris, and I can draw on some of its residual energy to extend our forcefield out around both ships. It won’t last forever but it’1l keep long enough for us to conduct a search.
CORWYN: Is that possible? Altus?
ALTUS: I can’t see any reason why not.
CORWYN: Then that’s what we’re going to do. Riga. Prepare to dock.
CORWYN: (THE SKIMMER MOVES FORWARD. SOUNDS OF TWO SHIPS LOCKING
TOGETHER: )
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 87
DOCTOR WHO: (AN AIRLOCK DOOR HISSES OPEN. THE SURVIVORS CLAMBER ABOARD AND
ADVANCE: )
CORWYN: Follow me, single file. Bows drawn, just in case.
TUVOLD: I really don’t know how to work this thing...
TYRON: Just keep away from the pointy end, you’1ll be fine.
ALTUS: No desire for a bow, Doctor?
DOCTOR: I prefer reasoning and diplomacy.
CORWYN: Really? Well, when your words aren’t stopping an insane Igris tearing you apart, we’ll see what you think of weapons then. This way.
DOCTOR: Ship’s prettier than I expected...
TUVOLD: Well, it is a wedding galley. She dressed in the crown jewels for the occasion too. The Ashfarn Cloak. The Royal Carcanet. Priceless.
DOCTOR: So romance isn’t dead. Let’s hope the Princess isn’t either.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 88
DOCTOR: (AT DOOR) Oh no.
KYLO: Aliona!
RIGA: That’s not a good sign.
CORWYN: Check the bodies. Find out who they are.
KYLO: Aliona, is she here?
DOCTOR: Must be a couple of dozen corpses. How many people were there onboard this ship?
TUVOLD: A couple of dozen.
KYLO: Can anyone see Aliona?
CORWYN: Riga, scan for life signs.
RIGA: Commander.
KYLO: I said, can anyone see Aliona?!
ALTUS: Your highness, keep calm.
KYLO: Don’t tell me to keep calm, Altus, the woman I love may be dead on the floor, DON’T TELL ME TO KEEP CALM!
CORWYN: What the — ?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 89
RIGA: I’m only seeing us.
TUVOLD: Doctor, what was that? An electrical fault?
DOCTOR: You know, I’m beginning to get a worrying feeling...
RIGA: There’s no Drashani life signs anywhere aboard this ship other than us.
KYLO: What?
ALTUS: Your highness —
KYLO: None, you’re saying none?
CORWYN: No.
ALTUS: Kylo, please —
KYLO: None at all?
RIGA: Nothing.
KYLO: She’s dead.
DOCTOR: Your highness, I am truly sorry —
KYLO: I don’t need sorrow, I need my wife! MY DEAD WIFE!
TUVOLD: What on —
CORWYN: Another computer — ?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 90
RIGA: Forget the computer! Look at his hands!
ALTUS: This is not a problem.
TUVOLD: It’s like they’re on fire!
DOCTOR: Sparking, yes, I see what’s happening here...
KYLO: She’s dead! She’s dead and gone!
ALTUS: Please, your highness, remember you haven’t taken —
DOCTOR: Keep away from him.
TUVOLD: What, why?
DOCTOR: Just keep away.
ALTUS: Listen to me, this is fine!
DOCTOR: There’s fire in his eyes, Altus, does that look fine? Keep back!
ALTUS: Stay — calm!
KYLO: Calm? CALM!
RIGA: He’s glowing!
DOCTOR: Altus, please, this is not a good idea ....
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 91
CORWYN: What’s happening?
RIGA: Doctor?
ALTUS: Please, your highness, you can stop this now! You don’t have to
KYLO: (YELLING LIKE A MADMAN) Don’t have to what? Can you bring her to me, Altus? Can you bring me Aliona!
ALTUS: (BEAT) I can’t, no, you know that I can’t.
KYLO: Then what! Use! Are you! YAAARGH!
ALTUS: Gaaargh!
CORWYN: Oh my —
TUVOLD: What in Empire’s —?
KYLO: Burn! Burn, all of you!
CORWYN: Everybody out! Now!
CORWYN: (THEY RUN FROM THE ROOM. KYLO SCREECHING, FIRES BURSTING OUT
ALL: AROUND)
KYLO: Bring me my wife! Bring me my wife!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 92
DOCTOR WHO: (THE SURVIVORS RUNNING DOWN THE CORRIDOR. FIRES BURNING BEHIND THEM)
DOCTOR: A pyro-kinetic, I should have realised! The explosions during our descent...
TUVOLD: A what?
DOCTOR: Pyro-kinetic. He can start fires with his thoughts...
CORWYN: Really?
DOCTOR: Altus just burst into flames, Commander, I think it’s a fairly
DOCTOR: safe guess! We’re next if we don’t get out of his way...
TYRON: But where do we go? He’s between us and the skimmer.
DOCTOR: The design of this place is fairly circular. There’1ll be another route round. This door here, I think...
RIGA: And Kylo?
DOCTOR: I think it’s triggered by stress, that’s what happened back on the lander. Give him time to calm down and —
DOCTOR: (THE DOOR OPENS. BEHIND THE TELL-TALE GROWL OF A MASS OF
APPROACHING: IGRIS)
APPROACHING: -we might be alright. Ah. Out of the frying pan —
TUVOLD: Igris!
TYRON: Get back!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 93
RIGA: Bowing up!
RIGA: (SHE UNSHOULDERS HER BOW AND STARTS TO LOOSE OFF SHOTS. CORWYN
DOES: TOO)
CORWYN: Keep back! Keep back! (CALLING BACK) I thought these things couldn’t get in!
DOCTOR: There must have been some inside when I extended the field!
TUVOLD: We’re trapped!
TYRON: There’s too many, we can’t — Aargh!
TYRON: (ONE OF THE IGRIS SLASHES AT TYRON, CATCHES HIM A GLANCING BOW. HE FALLS, MOANING IN PAIN. CORWYN AND RIGA CONTINUE TO FIRE)
DOCTOR: Murderous aliens ahead of us — grief stricken maniacal arsonist
DOCTOR: behind.
CORWYN: DOCTOR!
DOCTOR: You know — I think we might be in trouble.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 94

elements.text: PART THREE
THEME
58: INT. WEDDING GALLEY (CORRIDOR) CONTINUED
Murderous aliens ahead of us — grief stricken maniacal arsonist behind.
DOCTOR!
You know — I think we might be in trouble.
(THE IGRIS ADVANCE.
WHOMPING SOUND AS A PULSE WHIPS DOWN THE CORRIDOR. THE
CRY IN PAIN. RIGA AND CORWYN STOP FIRING)
Doctor, what’s happening?
I don’t —
(THE SOUND AGAIN. THE IGRIS WAIL, COLLAPSE AND DIE. TYRON
MOANING. IN THE BACKGROUND FIRES STILL ERUPT)
They’re dying!
But how?
A SPEAKER CRACKLES
I don’t (know) — Listen! Someone’s accessing the speakers!
(OVER SPEAKER) Attention wedding galley. Attention. This is Princess Aliona of the Gadarel.
Aliona?
The princess?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 95
She’s alive!
What?
Well, this changes everything.
(OVER SPEAKER) The Igris outside are dead. Hopefully any in there too. But there’1ll be more.
How can she be alive? Everyone’s dead!
I’ve no idea.
(OVER SPEAKER) I’m trying to board but I can’t get past the forcewall. Can you let me in please?
Doctor?
I repeat, can you let me in please?
BEAT
Riga, head for the skimmer. Drop the forcefield and let her
board. Get it straight back up when she’s in.
Got it!
SHE RUNS OFF
(CALLING OUT) Then bring her down here.
She’s alive? My niece is alive?
(THOUGHTFUL) Yes...
We’ve done it! The mission’s a success!
on
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 96
There’s no time for celebrations now, we need Kylo stabilised.
THERE’S A BIG EXPLOSION BEHIND
As soon as possible.
You think she’1l stop him?
Hopefully. He’s a danger to us all while he’s like this.
BIG MOAN FROM TYRON
Still here, Tyron?
Just about...
You were lucky. Must have been a glancing blow...
Don’t feel lucky.
You're losing a lot of blood. Tuvold, Corwyn, have either of you medical experience? Someone needs to look after him.
Um, some field training —
Good, see what you can do. Tuvold, help him.
HE RUNS OFF
I’m going to try to reason with Kylo.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 97
59: INT. WEDDING GALLEY (MAIN ROOM
KYLO THROWING FLAMES EVERYWHERE
Bring her back! Bring her back to me!
THE DOCTOR ARRIVES, HANGS BACK
Kylo! Kylo, it’s the Doctor!
Keep back! Keep back if you want to live!
HE BLASTS OFF ANOTHER FLAME
Kylo, please, you don’t have to do this, we’ve found her, we've found Aliona, she’s alive.
She’s not alive, Doctor! Can’t you see? She’s dead, they’re all dead, look around you!
ANOTHER BURST OF FLAME
I’m not making it up, Kylo, I wouldn’t lie to you.
Everyone died in the crash!
They didn’t, please, give me a chance! She’s out there, she’s alive!
BEAT. KYLO ALMOST CALMS, STILL BREATHES HEAVILY
She’s —
Alive, yes.
(BEAT) How?
I don’t know, you’1ll have to ask her.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 98
(ANGRY) Are you lying to me?
I wouldn’t do that, your highness, I know how much she meant to you. Please.
PAUSE
Bring her here.
She’s on her way.
Bring her here now!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 99
60: INT. WEDDING GALLEY (CORRIDOR
CORWYN AND TUVOLD ATTENDING TYRON
And hold that down...
RIGA AND ALIONA RUN UP
(CALLING AS SHE RUNS UP) Uncle Tuvold!
Aliona!
THEY EMBRACE
I give you Princess Aliona of the Gadarel.
Is the forcewall back up?
Barely. The power was low before we extended it, it can’t last long at this range.
ALIONA AND TUVOLD BREAK APART
You came for me! I never thought I’d see a Gadarel again. But you came! You came for me!
Not just me. Kylo too. Your husband to be is here as well.
Kylo? Kylo’s here?
Yes.
(BEAT) Where?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 100
61: INT. WEDDING GALLEY (MAIN ROOM
I’m waiting, Doctor!
You’re not the only one...
If she is alive, where is she?
She’s on her way, I simply don’t know how long it’1ll take for — Ah!
CORWYN, ALIONA AND TUVOLD RUN UP
Doctor!
Corwyn, Tuvold, you’ve —
Aliona!
Kylo!
SHE RUNS IN. THEY EMBRACE
I’m going to take a stab in the dark and assume that’s our missing Princess.
Safe and well.
She certainly looks the part. Such fine clothing and jewellery and... is that a gun?
It’s not part of the traditional marriage vestments.
I’d hope not. Probably what she used on the Igris...
Riga’s taken Tyron back to the ship, she’ll try and patch him up on board.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL)
Excellent.
THE COUPLE BREAK APART
I thought you were.. I thought you'd...
Hush now.
I thought you were dead.
Do I look dead?
(BEAT) You look amazing.
(BEAT) I love you.
I love you too.
THEY KISS
Yes, I think we should perhaps give them a moment...
Oh, er, quite.
If we must...
THEY MOVE OFF. THE COUPLE BREAK
I thought I’d never see you again.
I thought I’d lost you. Your ship. What happened?
Page 101
We were infiltrated by anti-Gadarel fanatics. Saboteurs.
Us too! How did you — ?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 102
Survive? My crew. They sacrificed themselves. Reversed the shields to create a protective bubble within the ship. It was only big enough for me.
(BEAT) Then we won’t forget them. They shall be the first honoured under our new — (HE STOPS HIMSELF) Altus!
HE RUNS ACROSS THE ROOM TO THE BODY
Altus. I killed Altus.
Yes.
You — ?
(BEAT) I burnt him. Burnt him alive.
Burnt him?
It was an accident! I didn’t mean to!
We'll deal with it later. Presently I’m rather more concerned with the people who are still alive. The Igris won’t be gone forever.
But the forcewal1ll...
Is a temporary solution at best. Keep it extended too long and we won’t be able to sustain it all.
What about your weapon, Aliona? That’s what disposed of the Igris just now?
It uses vast amounts of power, it takes time to recharge.
Time, I think it is safe to assume, we don’t have. We need to get back to the Skimmer and out of here fast.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 103

There’s an abandoned mining base close by, that’s where I’ve been hiding. It’s got its own forcewall, and a shuttle. Sorsha technology, I couldn’t figure out the controls, but you will. We can use that to get off world.
Excellent, then that’s where we’re going. Back to the skimmer! MOVE!
But we don’t need to go to there, there’s my capsule —
Now!
Come, my sweet...
THEY RUN FROM THE ROOM. AS THEY GO
It never stops, does it?
Very rarely.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 104
62: INT. WEDDING GALLEY (CORRIDOR
THE GROUP RUNNING
Come on people, move it, move it! We’ve not got all day!
AS THEY RUN:
Your highness, that weapon of yours, the one you used on the Igris, can I take a look?
Certainly.
SHE THROWS IT OVER
Hmm. A gene based firing system.
You recognize the technology?
No, I’m just very observant.
Our scientists developed it a few months back. It locks onto broad strands of DNA and destroys anything bearing that genetic code.
Very clever. A pulse weapon. You carpet an entire area and only affect those you’ve chosen to affect, sparing everyone else. That’s how you killed the Igris.
I saw your ship crash. I knew where you’d be heading, I thought it might be necessary to mount a rescue.
And believe me, I’m very glad you did. Though I’m not exactly pleased about the means you used to do it...
I’m sorry?
It’s a shame it required such mass slaughter. I’m sure this weapon could easily be adjusted to stun rather than kill.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 105
I don’t understand.
The Doctor’s something of a pacifist, Aliona. He doesn’t approve of bloodshed.
Then he hasn’t lived his whole life in wartime, has he? Some things are evil, Doctor, they deserve to die.
HE THROWS BACK THE WEAPON
We’ll have to agree to disagree.
Enough talk back there!
Yes, yes, we’re going as quick as we can!
Get on with it!
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 106
63: INT. SKIMMER (AIRLOCK
THE GROUP THUNDER ON BOARD
Right, everyone on board? Seal the airlock, I’m heading for the control deck.
(ENTERING) Yes, yes...
CORWYN CHARGES OFF. THE DOCTOR OPERATES THE CONTROLS
And door... sealed.
HE RUNS AFTER CORWYN
64: EXT. SHARNAX (DRY AREA
THE SKIMMER DISENGAGES FROM THE GALLEY AND FLOATS OFF
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 107
65: INT. SKIMMER (CONTROL
RIGA OPERATING CONTROLS AS THE DOCTOR RUNS UP
We have disengaged. Doctor, can you retract the forcewall?
(SITTING AND OPERATING CONTROLS) Retracting the forcewall to just the skimmer, yes, done. Don’t think it can last long. Not more than thirty minutes...
That’s plenty of time. Pilot. Enter destination, we’re heading for the mining base.
(OPERATING CONTROLS) Sir.

Commander, I’ve a far more convenient method of escape than that ship, I mentioned it earlier. From what Aliona said the shuttle isn’t ready to launch. There’1ll be all manner of procedures to get through, now if we head for my TARDIS we can be out of here in moments...
Destination entered.
Good. No, Doctor, we're heading for the mining base.
But it’s a needless risk...
It’s got a fully powered forcewall of its own, we’ll be safe.
Not if it breaks down, there’s still the question of who sabotaged the Alendra, they might still be with us.
That’s the point. I don’t know who I can trust. Least of all you.
Me?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 108
You've been invaluable, yes, but I don’t know who you are, what you want. I don’t even know if this ship of yours exists.
I’ve been trying to save everyone!
And people keep dying. You said we’d be safe on the galley. So where did those creatures come from?
I explained that.
One possible explanation, yes.
Corwyn, if I’m trying to kill you, I’ve a funny way of going about it!

Or you’re playing a very clever game. My cargo’s too precious to risk. I’ve got to place my trust in certainties, if there’s a chance you’re leading us into a trap I have to take the safer option. I’m sorry. Pilot, proceed as ordered.
Sir.
SHE OPERATES CONTROLS. THE SKIMMER MOVES
Then on your head be it!
THE DOCTOR STORMS OFF
He'll get over it.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 109
66: INT. SKIMMER (REAR
TYRON BREATHING HEAVILY; TUVOLD TENDING
MOANING
(WALKING UP) Honestly, of all the idiotic, hair brained — !
Doctor —

We’re not heading for my ship, we’re heading for the mining compound. In all my lives I’ve never seen any individual less fit for command than... well, actually, I’ve seen several individuals less fit for command than Mister Corwyn, but that’s not the point, the point is —
Doctor! You’ll wake the patient.
What? Oh, yes, Tyron, of course. Sorry. (BEAT) How is he?

Hard to say. I’m an Ambassador, not a medic. I’m well outside my comfort zone. Trying to enjoy the novelty. He’s lost a lot of blood. Riga used a surgeo-graft from the medikit to patch him up, but there’s only so much we can do, the sooner we get him back to civilization the better.
If we get back. We could get him away from here so much more quickly if Corwyn would just listen. —
THE SKIMMER LURCHES TO A HALT
Ah. Sounds like we’ve arrived.
67: EXT. SHARNAX (SWAMP
(THE SKIMMER CONNECTS AGAIN. IGRIS GROWLING, CIRCLING THE
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 110
68. INT. MINING BASE (CONTROL ROOM
(DOORS HISS OPEN. THE SURVIVORS ENTER, TYRON LIMPING IN WITH
Through here.
Come along, Tyron...
Not exactly homely, is it?
It hasn’t been used in forty years, what did you expect?
This is where you were living?
I didn’t have much choice.
Riga, do you think you can use those controls?
I can try. (SHE MOVES TO THE CONTROLS, STARTS WORKING THEM) Bit old. Rusty. But simple enough. Some rewiring and I might be able to bypass the systems.
Then get on with it. Try to unlock the shuttle launching protocols.
Sir.
(TO ALIONA) Are there more rooms?
This corridor.
ALL BAR RIGA HEAD FOR THE NEXT ROOM. AS THEY GO
It would have been so much easier if we’d just gone for the
TARDIS.
I know, Doctor. I know. (ALL BAR RIGA EXIT)
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 111
69: INT. MINING BASE (MAIN ROOM
A DOOR HISSES OPEN. THE GROUP ENTER
That corridor there leads to the launch tunnel, two floors below. That way’s the bedrooms, kitchen. This is the living quarters.
Comfy. Tyron, you should sit.
Alright.
HE SITS
How are you feeling?
Fine. (HE COUGHS AND SPLUTTERS )
You don’t sound fine. You need proper medical attention, that
graft won’t last long.
Long enough.
I’1l check the shuttle. Everyone wait here.
CORWYN DEPARTS
Let’s see what’s happening outside.
(HE PRESSES A BUTTON. A WINDOW COVER SLIDES OPEN. OUTSIDE HUNDREDS OF IGRIS MOVING ABOUT. PACING. GROWLING.
INSIDE THE IGRIS NOISE CONTINUES, MUTED)
They’re still massing.
They know we’re here. And they want us gone.
Really? I want us gone too. You think it’d be a simple compromise.
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 112
THE DOCTOR CROSSES THE ROOM
Er... Kylo...
Yes?
I think it’s time we talked about what happened on the Galley, don’t you?
(WARNING) Doctor...
No, no, it’s quite alright, Tuvold, I can fight my own battles.
What happened?
Well... you saw, didn’t you? I set him on fire. I got angry and I set him on fire.
Ky lo...
I didn’t mean to. I didn’t. I might not have liked him but I never wanted to kill him.
I’m glad to hear it.
I swear, Doctor, I will make reparation for that man’s life. I will. But it was an accident, you have to know that, I didn’t want him to die.
I know. You’re a pyro-kinetic aren’t you? You can make things burn with your mind?
(BEAT) It just happens. When I’m angry, when I lose control...
Yes?
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 113
. things burst into flame.
You know about this?
I know of it. A very specific form of telekinesis.
Of what?

The ability to psychically manoeuvre objects without touching them. Our young Prince can’t quite do that but he can manipulate matter at a fairly fundamental level. When he gets excited, agitated... so do the molecules of whatever he happens to focus on. They move rapidly, rub up against each other. The friction causes them to burst into flame.
That’s what it is?
That’s what it is.
PAUSE
I’ve always known I was different. I was told. From an early age.. my brain doesn’t work like other people’s.
What are you talking about?
Why do you think our Great-Grandfather went mad, split the family? He was like this too. Drove him insane.
I don’t understand.
There’s a recurrent genetic abnormality in the Drashani royal house. In our minds. It’s random, it doesn’t affect everyone, just some of us. And it affects me. I have a mutated brain.
No.
We tried to keep it secret. I took medication to suppress it...
THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 114
Oh, my love...
But it never goes away. It never truly goes. I’m sorry.
For what?
That I didn’t tell you. I should have told you. (BEAT) Can you still love me? Can you, Aliona?
Oh my beautiful man, how can you even ask?
