DOCTOR: And believe me, I’m very glad you did. Though I’m not exactly pleased about the means you used to do it...
ALIONA: I’m sorry?
DOCTOR: It’s a shame it required such mass slaughter. I’m sure this weapon could easily be adjusted to stun rather than kill.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 105
ALIONA: I don’t understand.
KYLO: The Doctor’s something of a pacifist, Aliona. He doesn’t approve of bloodshed.
ALIONA: Then he hasn’t lived his whole life in wartime, has he? Some things are evil, Doctor, they deserve to die.
DOCTOR: We’ll have to agree to disagree.
CORWYN: Enough talk back there!
DOCTOR: Yes, yes, we’re going as quick as we can!
CORWYN: Get on with it!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 106
CORWYN: Right, everyone on board? Seal the airlock, I’m heading for the control deck.
TUVOLD: (ENTERING) Yes, yes...
DOCTOR: And door... sealed.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 107
RIGA: We have disengaged. Doctor, can you retract the forcewall?
DOCTOR: (SITTING AND OPERATING CONTROLS) Retracting the forcewall to just the skimmer, yes, done. Don’t think it can last long. Not more than thirty minutes...
CORWYN: That’s plenty of time. Pilot. Enter destination, we’re heading for the mining base.
RIGA: (OPERATING CONTROLS) Sir.
DOCTOR: Commander, I’ve a far more convenient method of escape than that ship, I mentioned it earlier. From what Aliona said the shuttle isn’t ready to launch. There’1ll be all manner of procedures to get through, now if we head for my TARDIS we can be out of here in moments...
RIGA: Destination entered.
CORWYN: Good. No, Doctor, we're heading for the mining base.
DOCTOR: But it’s a needless risk...
CORWYN: It’s got a fully powered forcewall of its own, we’ll be safe.
DOCTOR: Not if it breaks down, there’s still the question of who sabotaged the Alendra, they might still be with us.
CORWYN: That’s the point. I don’t know who I can trust. Least of all you.
DOCTOR: Me?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 108
CORWYN: You've been invaluable, yes, but I don’t know who you are, what you want. I don’t even know if this ship of yours exists.
DOCTOR: I’ve been trying to save everyone!
CORWYN: And people keep dying. You said we’d be safe on the galley. So where did those creatures come from?
DOCTOR: I explained that.
CORWYN: One possible explanation, yes.
DOCTOR: Corwyn, if I’m trying to kill you, I’ve a funny way of going about it!
CORWYN: Or you’re playing a very clever game. My cargo’s too precious to risk. I’ve got to place my trust in certainties, if there’s a chance you’re leading us into a trap I have to take the safer option. I’m sorry. Pilot, proceed as ordered.
RIGA: Sir.
DOCTOR: Then on your head be it!
CORWYN: He'll get over it.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 109
DOCTOR: (WALKING UP) Honestly, of all the idiotic, hair brained — !
TUVOLD: Doctor —
DOCTOR: We’re not heading for my ship, we’re heading for the mining compound. In all my lives I’ve never seen any individual less fit for command than... well, actually, I’ve seen several individuals less fit for command than Mister Corwyn, but that’s not the point, the point is —
TUVOLD: Doctor! You’ll wake the patient.
DOCTOR: What? Oh, yes, Tyron, of course. Sorry. (BEAT) How is he?
TUVOLD: Hard to say. I’m an Ambassador, not a medic. I’m well outside my comfort zone. Trying to enjoy the novelty. He’s lost a lot of blood. Riga used a surgeo-graft from the medikit to patch him up, but there’s only so much we can do, the sooner we get him back to civilization the better.
DOCTOR: If we get back. We could get him away from here so much more quickly if Corwyn would just listen. —
DOCTOR: Ah. Sounds like we’ve arrived.
DOCTOR: (THE SKIMMER CONNECTS AGAIN. IGRIS GROWLING, CIRCLING THE
VEHICLE: )
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 110
DOCTOR WHO: (DOORS HISS OPEN. THE SURVIVORS ENTER, TYRON LIMPING IN WITH
TUVOLD: )
ALIONA: Through here.
TUVOLD: Come along, Tyron...
DOCTOR: Not exactly homely, is it?
CORWYN: It hasn’t been used in forty years, what did you expect?
KYLO: This is where you were living?
ALIONA: I didn’t have much choice.
CORWYN: Riga, do you think you can use those controls?
RIGA: I can try. (SHE MOVES TO THE CONTROLS, STARTS WORKING THEM) Bit old. Rusty. But simple enough. Some rewiring and I might be able to bypass the systems.
CORWYN: Then get on with it. Try to unlock the shuttle launching protocols.
RIGA: Sir.
CORWYN: (TO ALIONA) Are there more rooms?
ALIONA: This corridor.
DOCTOR: It would have been so much easier if we’d just gone for the
DOCTOR: TARDIS.
TUVOLD: I know, Doctor. I know. (ALL BAR RIGA EXIT)
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 111
ALIONA: That corridor there leads to the launch tunnel, two floors below. That way’s the bedrooms, kitchen. This is the living quarters.
TUVOLD: Comfy. Tyron, you should sit.
TYRON: Alright.
DOCTOR: How are you feeling?
TYRON: Fine. (HE COUGHS AND SPLUTTERS )
DOCTOR: You don’t sound fine. You need proper medical attention, that
DOCTOR: graft won’t last long.
TYRON: Long enough.
CORWYN: I’1l check the shuttle. Everyone wait here.
DOCTOR: Let’s see what’s happening outside.
DOCTOR: (HE PRESSES A BUTTON. A WINDOW COVER SLIDES OPEN. OUTSIDE HUNDREDS OF IGRIS MOVING ABOUT. PACING. GROWLING.
BACK: INSIDE THE IGRIS NOISE CONTINUES, MUTED)
TUVOLD: They’re still massing.
DOCTOR: They know we’re here. And they want us gone.
TUVOLD: Really? I want us gone too. You think it’d be a simple compromise.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 112
DOCTOR: Er... Kylo...
KYLO: Yes?
DOCTOR: I think it’s time we talked about what happened on the Galley, don’t you?
TUVOLD: (WARNING) Doctor...
KYLO: No, no, it’s quite alright, Tuvold, I can fight my own battles.
DOCTOR: What happened?
KYLO: Well... you saw, didn’t you? I set him on fire. I got angry and I set him on fire.
ALIONA: Ky lo...
KYLO: I didn’t mean to. I didn’t. I might not have liked him but I never wanted to kill him.
DOCTOR: I’m glad to hear it.
KYLO: I swear, Doctor, I will make reparation for that man’s life. I will. But it was an accident, you have to know that, I didn’t want him to die.
DOCTOR: I know. You’re a pyro-kinetic aren’t you? You can make things burn with your mind?
KYLO: (BEAT) It just happens. When I’m angry, when I lose control...
DOCTOR: Yes?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 113
KYLO: . things burst into flame.
ALIONA: You know about this?
DOCTOR: I know of it. A very specific form of telekinesis.
TUVOLD: Of what?
DOCTOR: The ability to psychically manoeuvre objects without touching them. Our young Prince can’t quite do that but he can manipulate matter at a fairly fundamental level. When he gets excited, agitated... so do the molecules of whatever he happens to focus on. They move rapidly, rub up against each other. The friction causes them to burst into flame.
KYLO: That’s what it is?
DOCTOR: That’s what it is.
KYLO: I’ve always known I was different. I was told. From an early age.. my brain doesn’t work like other people’s.
ALIONA: What are you talking about?
KYLO: Why do you think our Great-Grandfather went mad, split the family? He was like this too. Drove him insane.
ALIONA: I don’t understand.
KYLO: There’s a recurrent genetic abnormality in the Drashani royal house. In our minds. It’s random, it doesn’t affect everyone, just some of us. And it affects me. I have a mutated brain.
ALIONA: No.
KYLO: We tried to keep it secret. I took medication to suppress it...
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 114
ALIONA: Oh, my love...
KYLO: But it never goes away. It never truly goes. I’m sorry.
ALIONA: For what?
KYLO: That I didn’t tell you. I should have told you. (BEAT) Can you still love me? Can you, Aliona?
ALIONA: Oh my beautiful man, how can you even ask?
TUVOLD: Gladdens the heart, doesn’t it?
DOCTOR: (UNCONVINCED) Yes.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 115
RIGA: Commander, Riga. I’m nearly done. The system’s online, I’ve initiated fuelling procedure, just need to over-ride the key- codes, upload the flight pattern and we can launch. (BEAT) Commander? Commander, are you there? (BEAT) Hmm.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 116
KYLO: Tyron, stop, stop, sit down, the Doctor said you should be careful.
TYRON: (BREATHING HEAVILY) I don’t want to be careful. I’m a soldier, I’ve sat long enough. Give me my bow.
KYLO: If you insist.
TUVOLD: Why are the military always so stubborn?
DOCTOR: It does seem to go with the territory, doesn’t it? (BEAT) Well, at least we know what we’re dealing with now.
TUVOLD: We do?
DOCTOR: As long as we keep the young Prince calm we shouldn’t have to worry about another outburst like on the Galley.
TUVOLD: Hopefully Aliona will prove a calming influence.
DOCTOR: Hopefully. (BEAT) You know, the Commander’s been gone an awfully long time. I wonder if he’s [alright?]
DOCTOR: (THE DOOR TO THE BEDROOMS IS SMASHED APART AND AN IGRIS BURSTS
THROUGH: )
KYLO: Igris!
TUVOLD: How did they — ?
TYRON: Run!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 117
KYLO: There’s dozens of them!
ALIONA: No!
TYRON: Run!
TYRON: (HE LOOSES OFF ARROWS, AS THE OTHERS RETREAT. THE IGRIS IS
FOLLOWED: BY MORE, FLOWING INTO THE ROOM)
KYLO: Aliona, quickly!
ALIONA: But the gun —
TUVOLD: I’ve got it!
TYRON: I said run!
DOCTOR: Everyone! Head for the shuttle! Quickly!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 118
KYLO: How did they get in? I thought the forcewall was up!
DOCTOR: Clearly not any more!
TUVOLD: Our saboteur’s back.
DOCTOR: I don’t think he was ever gone. Your highnesses! Get to the shuttle!
KYLO: Right, yes, of course. Aliona.
ALIONA: Coming.
DOCTOR: (CALLING OVER HIS SHOULDER) And keep him calm! (TO TYRON) You alright, Tyron?
TYRON: I’1l live.
TUVOLD: What are you doing?
DOCTOR: The forcewall may be down, but I can replicate its effects here at least with a variable pulse on the doorway. Won’t last long but it’ll keep them at bay for a couple of minutes.
DOCTOR: (A SHATTERING CRASH FROM THE OTHER SIDE. HE WORKS THE BUTTONS AGAIN. A BURST OF ENERGY )
DOCTOR: There. They won’t find that so easy to get through. We can head for — ah.
TUVOLD: What’s the matter?
DOCTOR: Riga.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 119
TYRON: She’s still in the control room.
DOCTOR: And if she hasn’t unlocked the controls we won’t be able to launch the shuttle. We’ll be trapped.
DOCTOR: There must be some internal communications systems. I just need to find the right... Ah!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 120
RIGA: (ANSWERING) Yes, Commander, I’m nearly done, the key codes are cracked, you’ll be ready to launch in five. That good?
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) It’s wonderful, but I’m not the Commander.
RIGA: Doctor? Where’s Corwyn?
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Oh, I think he’s safe. Riga, there’s a problem. The Igris have broken into the base.
RIGA: What? You let them in?
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Not again. I’m trying to save your life.
RIGA: (BEAT) Okay, point taken. What do you want to do?
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) I’ve sent you the data to generate a temporary forcewall on the door, it should hold them back for a few minutes, have you received it?
RIGA: got it!
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Enter the codes into the locking mechanism.
RIGA: I’m way ahead of you. (SHE ENTERS THE CODES) Come on, come on... (SAME PULSE AS PREVIOUS SCENE) Done! (SHE RUNS BACK FOR THE DESK)
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Has it worked?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 121
RIGA: Like a dream. Right, what now?
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Ah, that’s just it, I’m afraid. I’ve no idea.
RIGA: (BEAT) Oh, great rescue plan. Knew there was a reason I didn’t like your damn house.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) I’m not Gadarel, Riga.
RIGA: Might as well be.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) We’re heading for the launch bay. Do you think you’1l be able to get through the living quarters to us?
RIGA: If the Igris are in there, no chance, I’m almost out of arrowbolts.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Then you’1ll have to find an alternate route over.
RIGA: (OPERATING CONTROLS) I’1l check the database.
DOCTOR: (DISTORT) Good. We’d better be moving. Keep us informed. Best of luck. Out.
RIGA: (READING) Alternate route to shuttle bay... none. Trapped.
RIGA: Looks like I’1l just have to work quickly, doesn’t it?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 122
TUVOLD: She’s dead, isn’t she?
DOCTOR: Let’s hope not.
TYRON: Right, that’s done. One magazine left.
TUVOLD: We’re out of arrows?
TYRON: Almost, I.. oh. (HE SWOONS, NEARLY COLLAPSES. TUVOLD CATCHES HIM)
DOCTOR: There, that should hold them back for — Is he alright?
TYRON: Think that run might have been a bit too much.
DOCTOR: (BEAT) Then we’1ll have to help him to the shuttle. Hope the Igris don’t beat us there. Come on. I’11l give you a hand.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 123
ALIONA: The shuttle, great!
KYLO: Aliona, wait! I need to send the lift back for the others.
ALIONA: Why? We’re the one’s we need to save.
KYLO: They helped me! (HE OPERATES CONTROLS) I can’t —
CORWYN: (BEHIND) Your highness —
ALIONA: (SUDDEN CRY) Behind you!
ALIONA: (KYLO TURNS. CORWYN SLAMS THE BUTT OF HIS BOW ACROSS KYLO’S FACE. WITH A CRY, KYLO DROPS TO THE FLOOR, UNCONSCIOUS )
ALIONA: You — you —
CORWYN: Don’t worry, he’s not dead. The butt of a bow’s not heavy enough to kill. Head of my house, you see, can’t just murder him. Have to leave him to the Igris. Keep the blood off my hands.
ALIONA: What?
CORWYN: This would have been so much simpler if we’d all just died on the ship. That was the plan. Why couldn’t we all have just died on the ship?
CORWYN: I’m sorry, your highness. This is how it has to be.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 124
DOCTOR: There. That must be the lift down to the shuttle bay. Rest here. I’11 call it.
TUVOLD: Didn’t think you’d be so heavy.
TYRON: Sorry. Army rations.
TYRON: (THEY REST HIM. THE DOCTOR OPERATES CONTROLS ON THE LIFT DOORS.
SOMEWHERE: BEHIND A DOOR SHATTERS. GROWLS OF APPROACHING IGRIS)
TUVOLD: Doctor?
DOCTOR: The Igris must be through, didn’t think it’d take them long.
TYRON: They’re behind us?
DOCTOR: And not carrying a dead weight, no offence. Won’t take more than a minute or two to catch up...
DOCTOR: And I’d rather you didn’t use that on them, Tuvold, if it’s all the same to you.
TUVOLD: Aliona’s gun? Don’t worry. Doesn’t look like it’s fully charged yet.
DOCTOR: Yes. You know, that’s odd. Funny thing to have with you ona wedding galley, isn’t it, a gun? Hardly the most romantic object in the world...
TYRON: Where’s that lift?
DOCTOR: I don’t know. Being a bit slow. It’s only got two floors to come, can’t take long. Unless Corwyn’s sabotaged it too.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 125
TUVOLD: (BAFFLED) Corwyn?
DOCTOR: Yes. (BEAT) Corwyn’s the saboteur.
TYRON: The Commander?
DOCTOR: Isn’t it obvious? Someone let the Igris in here, only Corwyn and Riga had the opportunity. If Riga wanted us dead she could have crashed the lander when we arrived. That’s why Corwyn was so difficult about heading for the TARDIS. The last thing he wanted was a swift departure. He’s been nothing but awkwardness Since we found out Aliona was alive. Are you really telling me you didn’t know?
TUVOLD: But why? I thought he wanted peace?
DOCTOR: I suspect you’d have to ask him.
DOCTOR: You know, I do hope this lift gets here on time...
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 126
DOCTOR WHO: (IN THE BACKGROUND THE LIFT DOORS CLOSE. IT RISES. ALIONA IS
BACKING: AWAY AS CORWYN ADVANCES )
ALIONA: Please. Please no.
CORWYN: I’m sorry.
ALIONA: Why are you doing this?
CORWYN: Morletz Five, does that mean anything to you?
ALIONA: Should it?
CORWYN: Just more collateral damage to you, isn’t it? You’re never in the firing line, are you, just sit in your palaces watching other people’s corpses pile up fighting your war. Well you’re in the firing line now.
ALIONA: If this is some kind of revenge...
CORWYN: My wife was on Morletz Five when your people bombed it. Don’t know how they got her out. She hasn’t woken up since. If she does she’1l be crippled for life even with the best medical care. And I can’t afford the best medical care.
ALIONA: Listen to me —
CORWYN: Do you know what a Commander’s salary is, highness? A pittance. Barely enough. So when they offered me the deal...
ALIONA: Who?
CORWYN: I don’t know their names. Fanatics. Die hard anti-Gadarel fanatics. Millions of credits for a suicide mission. Stop the marriage, she gets a chance to live. I couldn’t say no.
ALIONA: But you’d be dead.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 127
CORWYN: Rather she lives than me. (BEAT) Sorry. For what it’s worth... I do want peace. But not as much as I want my wife to stop suffering. I’m so sorry about this.
ALIONA: Oh, don’t be. Because if I’ve got any say in the matter, your wife is going to die in unbearable pain and agony.
CORWYN: What?
CORWYN: Aargh...
ALIONA: She won’t last long. But a little bit longer than you.
CORWYN: You — you...
ALIONA: Shot you, yes. Concealed weapons are a bit of a cheat, aren’t they... just needed you to drop your guard for a second, thanks for that...
CORWYN: a
ALIONA: I want peace too. But I want it through victory, not appeasement. My father was killed by your troops. Your stinking, traitorous troops, you think I want that to go for nothing? Get forgotten? I want the peace that comes when every last Sorsha is dead beneath my feet.
CORWYN: I...
ALIONA: Starting with you.
CORWYN: No, I —
ALIONA: Empire be praised. Now. Kylo, ‘my love’. (SHE STRUGGLES TO PICK UP KYLO) Let’s get on board... (SHE DRAGS HIM OFF)
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 128
TUVOLD: Doctor, they’re nearly here.
TYRON: I ain’t got enough arrows for the lot, you’d better have a plan.
DOCTOR: Not really.
DOCTOR: Well, that’s given me a lift. Quick, inside.
TYRON: They’re coming!
TUVOLD: Doctor, we need to hurry!
DOCTOR: I know, I know. Going down!
DOCTOR: (HE OPERATES THE LIFT. THE DOORS CLOSE, SHUTTING OUT THE
NEARING: IGRIS. THEY DROP AWAY)
NEARING: Well, looks like we got away with that.
NEARING: (ABOVE, THERE’S A TREMENDOUS WRENCHING SOUND AS THE DOOR IS
RIPPED: APART. AN IGRIS DROPS DOWN, LANDS ON THE ROOF WITH A THUD)
RIPPED: Maybe not.
TUVOLD: It’s on the roof!
DOCTOR: Perhaps I can adjust Aliona’s gun to stun...
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 129
TUVOLD: Doctor, it’s not got the power, we've no.. time...
DOCTOR: Tyron, what are you — ?
TYRON: Going up!
DOCTOR: There’s not enough space up there!
TYRON: I know.
DOCTOR: Keep back! Stay away from its claws!
DOCTOR: (THE LIFT REACHES THE TOP OF THE SHAFT. WITH A SICKENING CRUNCH THE IGRIS IS CRUSHED. IT SAGS AND DIES)
TUVOLD: That was too close.
DOCTOR: You killed it!
TYRON: I didn’t have much choice!
DOCTOR: (BEAT) I know. I don’t have to like it though. Well, hopefully that’1ll scare them off. We need to get to the Shuttle Bay. Looks like it’s our only way out of here...
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 130
RIGA: Oh, not yet, just need a few more seconds... The flight plan’s nearly uploaded... (BEAT) There!
RIGA: Doctor, Corwyn, don’t know if you can hear me, but I’m done, the shuttle’s free to go and —
RIGA: No!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 131
DOCTOR WHO: (THE LIFT DOORS PING OPEN. THE FIREFIGHT FROM THE CONTROL ROOM CONTINUES, DISTORTED OVER SPEAKERS AS TUVOLD AND THE DOCTOR
CARRY: OUT TYRON)
DOCTOR: Here we are...
TYRON: Doctor, listen!
RIGA: (DISTORT, LOOSING OFF ARROWS) Come on then! Do your worst! Empire be Praised! House Sorsha for - !
RIGA: (OVER THE SPEAKERS, SHE SCREAMS AND IS TORN APART. THE
COMMUNICATOR: CUTS OUT)
TUVOLD: She’s dead.
DOCTOR: She’s not the only one, look!
TUVOLD: Corwyn!
TYRON: He’s been shot!
DOCTOR: Yes. Now I wonder who could have done that?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 132
DOCTOR WHO: (SMALLISH SHUTTLE. ENGINES GOING. ALIONA AT A DISTANCE
OPERATING: CONTROLS. KYLO JERKS AWAKE WITH A START)
KYLO: What, where, what — (REGISTERS WHERE HE IS, GROGGY) Where are we, what happened?
ALIONA: Oh, you’re awake. We’re on the shuttle, how do you feel?
KYLO: Me, I — I’m... I’ve got an awful headache.
ALIONA: Yes, that’1ll be Corwyn. He knocked you out.
KYLO: What?
ALIONA: Smashed you in the face with the butt of his bow. You were out cold.
KYLO: Corwyn? Corwyn hit me? Commander Corwyn?
ALIONA: He was your saboteur. He brought down your ship.
KYLO: But — (HE TRIES TO MOVE, REACTS WITH PAIN) I can’t stand up...
ALIONA: No, I’ve tied you to the chair. Yes, good old dependable Corwyn. He’d been bribed by Anti-Gadarel fanatics, he was quite articulate about it. But he can’t harm you now. I killed him.
KYLO: What? You — ?
KYLO: (ALIONA PRESSES A SWITCH ON A DEVICE. A LOW BUZZING SOUND. KYLO GASPS IN PAIN)
ALIONA: Of course, he’s not the one you need to worry about.
KYLO: (IN PAIN) What are you — ?
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 133
ALIONA: It’s a psychic suppressor. We know about your little problem you see, my spies were very thorough. Wouldn’t want you...
ALIONA: flaring up on me.
KYLO: What are you doing?
ALIONA: Oh my sweet Prince. Still haven’t figured it out yet, have you?
KYLO: I don’t —
ALIONA: The marriage was a sham. A way to infiltrate your homeworld. Nothing more.
KYLO: (BEAT) No.
ALIONA: You fell for the pretty girl. Oldest trick in the book.
KYLO: What are you talking about?
ALIONA: I don’t love you. Never did.
KYLO: But... but you said...!
ALIONA: It was a lie. It was all a lie. Now shut up while I launch this thing.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 134
DOCTOR: Tyron, do you think you can get to the shuttle? That lift shaft won’t stop the Igris long and there’s other exit...
TYRON: Reckon I can —
DOCTOR: Oh no...
TUVOLD: Is that — ?
DOCTOR: The shuttle, it’s taking off!
DOCTOR: (THE ROAR OF ENGINES IS LOUDER AS THE DOCTOR AND TUVOLD APPROACH, TYRON HOBBLING BEHIND)
TUVOLD: But who’s on board?
DOCTOR: Keep back, keep back, the heat’1ll be too much...
TYRON: They’re leaving without us!
DOCTOR: I know, now keep back!
DOCTOR: (THEY DRAG TYRON BACK AS WITH A HUGE ROAR THE SHUTTLE LAUNCHES OFF AND AWAY. THE ROAR FADES AS THE ROCKET DIMINISHES. PAUSE. THEY ADVANCE ACROSS THE ROOM)
TUVOLD: It’s gone!
DOCTOR: Yes. And we’re not. Interesting.
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 135
TUVOLD: Doctor... what’s that? The Igris? I think I can hear the Igris.
DOCTOR: Ah, yes, they must have broken out of the lift shaft.
TUVOLD: Agh!
TYRON: There’s hundreds of them! Hundreds!
TUVOLD: Doctor, what do we do? There’s no way out, they’1ll kill us all!
TUVOLD: What do we do? DOCTOR!
DOCTOR WHO: THE BURNING PRINCE by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 136

elements.text: PART FOUR
